clinical_study.brief_title: Lu's Acupuncture and Moxibustion Treatment on Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Lu' Acupuncture and Moxibustion Treatment on Ischemic Stroke

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

clinical_study.source: Shanghai University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

oversight_info.authority: China: State Administration of Traditional Chinese Medicine of the People's Republic of China

brief_summary.textblock: There will be successive changes in traditional Chinese medicine rehabilitation for stroke patients with limb hemiparetic through therapy of acupuncture and moxibustion.

detailed_description.textblock: There will be difference in stroke outcomes of ischemic stroke patients with limb hemiparetic from acute to chronic phase under Lu' acupuncture and moxibustion.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment

intervention.description: The treatment group：60 patients receive Acupuncture and Moxibusiton，choosing shenting（A）、baihui（A）、fengchi（A）、hanyan（A）、jianyu（A）、quchi（A）、waiguan（A）、zusanli（A）、fenglong（A）、xingjian yongquan（M），20minutes each once，ten time as a period of treatment，two periods of treatment in all.
The matched group：60 patients receive rehabilitation exercise，45 minutes each once，ten time as a period of treatment，two periods of treatment in all.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The ages of stroke patients from 40 years old to 70 years old.
- The principle diagnosis according to <diagnosis-treatment criteria of stroke(trial implementation)>formulated by Collaboration Acute Brain Diseases of State Administration of Traditional Chinese Medicine in 1996；Ischemic stroke confirmed by CT brain or MRI brain,with stable medical condition and awareness clear.
- Recent stroke from 7 days to 6 months after onset.
- Stroke with limb movement disorder and hypomyotonia，NIHSS≤10，ASHWORTH≤1，GCS>8.
- Written informed consent by inpatient.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Stroke with conscious disturbance or serious cognitive impairment.
- Stroke with limb spasm；ASHWORTH≥1.
- Having cardiac pacemaker，metallic foreign body in treatment position，or hemorrhagic tendency.
- Being oversensitive to electrical stimulus.
